title: How to Make Chocolate Hazelnut Buns

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients.
steps.description: Add the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, salt, butter, yeast and water into a mixing bowl. You can mix the mixture by stirring with a large spoon or stirring rod, or stirring by machine on a low power for 4 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the rest of the ingredients.

text: Mix the ingredients. Add the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, salt, butter, yeast and water into a mixing bowl. You can mix the mixture by stirring with a large spoon or stirring rod, or stirring by machine on a low power for 4 minutes. Add the rest of the ingredients. Add the chocolate chips, crushed hazelnuts and the rest of the milk. Prepare the dough. Knead the dough into a ball on a floured surface. Leave for 5 minutes. Divide the dough. Separate the dough equally in two. Roll into logs. Put them into a tray and cover them with a towel. Allow them to rise. Set the buns aside for 2 hours to allow them to rise. Prepare the buns. Cut the logs into 1 inch (2.5 cm) slices and place the slices on a baking pan. Cut 2-3 slits into the top of each bun with a sharp knife and brush them with beaten egg. Set the oven to 180 C or 350 F.  Bake. Place them into the oven for 15 minutes. Bake until you notice the buns having a brownish colour. Serve.
